newsitem.title: FRANCE: GOLF-FINE PITCH HELPS CAGE TO THREE-SHOT LEAD.
newsitem.headline: GOLF-FINE PITCH HELPS CAGE TO THREE-SHOT LEAD.

text.p: A remarkable pitch shot at the last hole helped Stuart Cage of Britain to a closing birdie and a three-stroke lead in the third round of the Cannes Open on Saturday.

The 23-year-old Englishman, a former Walker Cup amateur, set up his chance for his maiden European Tour victory by atoning for an errant second shot with a superb 108-yard, nine-iron pitch from the side of a bank two fairways away and over a lake at the long 18th at Royal Mougins.
He then sank a five-foot birdie putt for a two-under-par round of 69 and a nine-under total of 204 to lead by three strokes from compatriots Paul Broadhurst and Paul Eales.
Sweden's Mathias Gronberg is another shot behind, one ahead of first round leader Santiago Luna of Spain and and Irish Ryder Cup player Philip Walton.

Cage, who relaxed by whistling and humming his favourite tune from a new recording he bought last week, had built a five-stroke lead after birdies at the 12th and 13th before Broadhurst and Eales closed in with good finishes.
But he responded magnificently to give himself a fine chance of Sunday on improving on his best previous finish, a playoff defeat in the 1995 Irish Open.

"I reckon I could only hope to pull that off once in every 10 times," Cage said of his final pitch. "The shot was almost blind, I could just see the top of the flag if I jumped up and down and I took aim on one of the course houses.
"I was lucky enough to land the ball on the slope in just the right place.
"When I'd got to five clear I wanted to make it six or seven and was determined not to play defensively, just sensibly. But it put the pressure on when the gap got narrowed."
He contributed to the situation by shooting bogey at the short 17th after finding a bunker.

Broadhurst, in contention for a return to the Ryder Cup team, birdied four of the last six holes for a 69 while Eales carded a 70 with four birdies over the closing seven holes, two of them huge putts.
